meanings.definition: To remove the magnetic properties from (an object)
meanings.sent1: I used a special tool to demagnetize the screwdriver.
meanings.sent2: The technician needed to demagnetize the hard drive before repairing it.
meanings.sent3: Trying to demagnetize a magnet is like trying to make ice warmer!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to demagnetize all the negativity in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand had the power to demagnetize any metal it touched.

meanings.sent1: The scientist wanted to demagnetize the iron bar for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: It is important to demagnetize credit cards before disposing of them.
meanings.sent3: He tried to demagnetize his keys, hoping they would stop sticking to everything.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to demagnetize the canvas, creating a sense of freedom.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's powers could demagnetize any metal, rendering it harmless.
